page.title: 16COMMUNICATION in W.G.C.
page.content: Asking questions at selected houses in both urban and rural parts of our area gave the information used for the following statements. Nearly all the people read a national {newspaper}and many also read a local paper. {Television}news programmes are watched regularly by most people and sometimes by the others. {Advertisements} in newspapers seem to be noticed more than those on t/v but more than half said they were not persuaded by advertisements at all. {Radio}news is listened to by over 75% and a majority think that local radio is useful. 80% of the homes had a{telephone}but few used the information services. 60% feel they have good{communication} with their neighbours, the rest claimed average or slight contact.
